column4: hey Im trying to move files to my SD card and it keeps having an Input/output error
hey Im trying to move files to my SD card and it keeps having an Input/output error
fsck the drive when it is unmounted
did the device fsck ok?
can you give the output of: lspci
and can you pastebin the output of: sudo lshw      thanks
http://pastebin.com/f29b72339
laptop wiki says it all works well on a Dell 1011. Let me keep digging
speed
well its downloading from multiple people so will be notably faster, it also allows users to download off you which eases strain on the servers
do you have the latest bios in your Dell?
lshw shows if the system tells it
try: sudo lshw | head -n 20
it will tell you
Bios physical ID: 1
lshw    says you have version A06 of your BIOS, you should see if there is a newer one
I think its the latest. I just got it on christmas.
i think i ran an exe on ubuntu once
chmod +x
can be ran with wine too ;)
What if i just copy my sd contents into my home dir and then formaat it to FAT again?
worth a try, maybe its a bug with the current kernel. have you tried an older one
no
